unique_object.name: serviceCDP
unique_object.fixImpact: The NMS could stop gathering information from this device
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could leak information network topology
unique_object.howtofix:
Run the command "no cdp run" to globally disable CDP. Or, run the "no cdp enable" command on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%CdpifsEnabled].
CDP protocol is already disabled on those interfaces: [%CdpifsDisabled].
unique_object.upgrade: Current IOS version disable this feature by default

unique_object.name: serviceLLDP
unique_object.fixImpact: The NMS could stop gathering information from this device
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could leak information network topology
unique_object.howtofix:
Run the command "no lldp run" to globally disable LLDP. Or, Run the "no lldp transmit" commands on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%LldpEnabledTx].
Run the "no lldp receive" commands on the following interfaces if they are not needed: [%LldpEnabledRx].
LLDP protocol is already disabled on those interfaces: [%LldpifsDisabled].
unique_object.upgrade: Current IOS version disable this feature by default

unique_object.threatInfo: When this feature is enabled, it is not possible to alter or remove these backup files. It is advised to enable this feature to prevent both inadvertent and malicious attempts to delete these files.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# secure boot-config

unique_object.name: archiveLogs
unique_object.definition: It makes it possible to log the configuration changes made to a Cisco IOS device
unique_object.threatInfo: The log is maintained on the Cisco IOS device and contains the user information of the individual who made the change, the configuration command entered, and the time that the change was made.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# archive (config-archive)# log config (config-archive-log-config)# logging enable (config-archive-log-config)# logging size 200 (config-archive-log-config)# hidekeys (config-archive-log-config)# notify syslog

unique_object.name: ipICMPunreachable
unique_object.definition: An ICMP unreachable message can be generated by a device
unique_object.threatInfo: It can increase CPU utilization.
unique_object.howtofix:
IP ICMP unreachable should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip unreachables": [%UnreachableifsEnabled].
IP ICMP unreachable are already disabled on those interfaces: [%UnreachableifsDisabled].
Or, rate-limit ICMP unreachable messages from the global configuration: (config)# ip icmp rate-limit unreachable 250

unique_object.name: proxyArp
unique_object.definition: Proxy ARP is the technique in which one device, usually a router, answers ARP requests that are intended for another device
unique_object.threatInfo: Utilizing proxy ARP can result in an increase in the amount of ARP traffic on the network segment and resource exhaustion and man-in-the-middle attacks.
unique_object.howtofix:
ARP proxy should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip proxy-arp": [%ArpifsEnabled].
ARP proxy are already disabled on those interfaces: [%ArpifsDisabled].

unique_object.name: ntpAuthentication
unique_object.threatInfo: Some evil hacker could easily craft NTP packets without this option.
unique_object.howtofix:
Enable NTP authentication: (config)# ntp authenticate
Configure the MD5 key (8 characters max.):
(config)# ntp authentication-key 10 md5 S3CUr1Ty

unique_object.name: bgpTTLsecurity
unique_object.threatInfo: Man in the middle could occurs if the TTL does not expires.
unique_object.howtofix:
It must be done for all the neighbors.
(config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 ttl-security hops 2

unique_object.name: bgpSessionPassword
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could send malicious BGP packets easily if M5 authentication is not configured.
unique_object.howtofix:
It must be done for all the neighbors.
(config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 password S3CUr1Ty

unique_object.name: bgpMaxPrefixes
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could overflow the configuration with prefixes incidentally or not.
unique_object.howtofix:
It must be done for all the neighbors.
(config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 maximum-prefix 1000 30

unique_object.name: bgpPrefixList
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could inject unneeded BGP prefixes.
unique_object.howtofix:
It must be done on all the neighbors and in both direction: In and Out. If there are too many prefixes to list then only filter the RFC3330 prefixes.
(config)# ip prefix-list PREFIXLISTIN seq 5 permit 0.0.0.0/0 (config)# ip prefix-list PREFIXLISTOUT seq 5 permit 192.168.2.0/24 (config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 prefix-list PREFIXLISTIN in (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 prefix-list PREFIXLISTOUT out

unique_object.name: bgpaspathList
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could inject unneeded BGP prefixes.
unique_object.howtofix:
It must be done for all the neighbors and in both direction: In and Out.
(config)# ip as-path access-list 1 permit ^65501$ (config)# ip as-path access-list 2 permit ^$ (config)# router bgp 12345 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 remote-as 1234 (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 filter-list 1 in (config-router)# neighbor 1.2.3.4 filter-list 2 out

unique_object.name: eigrpRouteFilteringOut

unique_object.name: ospfAuthModeMD5

Where X = [%ospfPID] and area-id = [%ospfArea]

unique_object.name: ospfMaxLSA
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could inject unwanted OSPF packets in the LAN.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# router ospf [%ospfInstance] (config-router)# max-lsa 12000

unique_object.name: glbpMD5
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could inject unwanted GLBP packets in the LAN.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# interface [%Interface] (config-if)# glbp 1 authentication md5 key-string 'glbp-secret'

unique_object.name: hsrpMD5
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could inject unwanted HSRP packets in the LAN.

unique_object.name: vrrpMD5

unique_object.name: tclsh
unique_object.threatInfo: Someone could take control over your network with TCL shell scripting.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# event manager applet EEM-APPLET-BLOCK-TCLSH event cli pattern "tclsh" sync yes action 1.0 syslog msg "Attempted tclsh command by user at $_event_pub_time" set 2.0 _exit_status 0

unique_object.name: IPoptions
unique_object.threatInfo: IP options are managed by CPU and could subvert traffic path.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# ip options drop

unique_object.name: IPsourceroute
unique_object.threatInfo: This functionality can be used in attempts to route traffic around security controls in the network.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# no ip source-route

unique_object.name: ipICMPredirects
unique_object.definition: An ICMP redirect message can be generated by a router when a packet is received and transmitted on the same interface
unique_object.threatInfo: This behavior allows the sender to bypass the router and forward future packets directly to the destination (or to a router closer to the destination).
unique_object.howtofix:
IP ICMP redirects should be removed on those interfaces by typing "no ip redirects": [%RedirectifsEnabled].
IP ICMP redirects are already disabled on those interfaces: [%RedirectifsDisabled].

unique_object.name: ICMPdeny
unique_object.threatInfo: Some ICMP messages are useful but external ICMP connectivity is rarely needed.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# ip access-list extended ACL-TRANSIT-IN (config-ext-nacl)# permit icmp host 'trusted-networks' any (config-ext-nacl)# deny icmp any any

unique_object.name: IPfrags
unique_object.threatInfo: Fragmentation is also often used in attempts to evade detection by intrusion detection systems.
unique_object.howtofix: (config)# ip access-list extended ACL-TRANSIT-IN (config-ext-nacl)# deny tcp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny udp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny icmp any any fragments (config-ext-nacl)# deny ip any any fragments

unique_object.name: urpf
unique_object.threatInfo: IP address spoofing.
unique_object.howtofix:
(config)# ip cef (config)# interface 'interface' (config-if)# ip verify unicast source reachable-via any
Interfaces needed to be fixed are the following: [%URPFCandidates].

unique_object.name: urpfv6
unique_object.threatInfo: IP address spoofing.
unique_object.howtofix:
(config)# ip cef (config)# interface 'interface' (config-if)# ipv6 enable (config-if)# ipv6 verify unicast source reachable-via [rx|any]
Interfaces needed to be fixed are the following: [%URPFv6Candidates].
